clinical_study.brief_title: GS-7977 and Ribavirin in Patients With Chronic HCV With Cirrhosis and Portal Hypertension With or Without Liver Decompensation
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Multicenter, Open-Label, Randomized Study to Investigate the Safety and Efficacy of GS-7977 and Ribavirin Administered for 48 Weeks in Patients Infected With Chronic HCV With Cirrhosis and Portal Hypertension With or Without Liver Decompensation

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, Open-Label, Randomized Study to Investigate the Safety and Efficacy of GS-7977 and Ribavirin Administered for 48 weeks in Patients Infected with Chronic HCV with Cirrhosis and Portal Hypertension with or without Liver Decompensation. Approximately 50 subjects (25 per group) will be randomized (1:1) to either receive study drug for 48 weeks or take part in an untreated observational arm for the first 24 weeks followed by study drug for another 48 weeks.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Sustained virologic response 12 weeks after discontinuation of therapy.
primary_outcome.description: Sustained virologic response 12 weeks after discontinuation of therapy (SVR12 defined as HCV RNA < lower limit of quantification [LLoQ] 12 weeks after last dose of study drug).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Hepatic Venous Pressure Gradient (HVPG) measurements
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after 48 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the effect of 48 weeks of treatment on portal pressure as measured by Hepatic Venous Pressure Gradient (HVPG) measurements

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and severity of adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Safety and Tolerability on treatment and 30 days post last dose
secondary_outcome.description: Assess safety laboratory tests and the number, frequency and severity of adverse events through 30 days post last dose of study drug

arm_group.description: 48 weeks of GS 7977 400 mg QD + RBV (1000 or 1200 mg/day) BID
24 weeks of Observation, then 48 weeks GS 7977 QD + RBV (1000 or 1200 mg/day) BID

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic infection with Hepatitis C with HCV RNA > 1000 IU/mL
- Subjects with cirrhosis with Child-Pugh score < 10.
- esophageal or gastric varices on endoscopy within 6 months prior to or at screening
- Hepatic Venous Pressure Gradient (HVPG) > 6 mmHg
- Body mass index (BMI) >/= 18 kg/m2
- Na√Øve to all nucleotides/nucleoside treatments for chronic HCV infection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have any serious or active medical or psychiatric illness which, in the opinion of the investigator, would interfere with subject treatment, assessment, or compliance
- HIV or chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection (HBsAg positive)
- Alpha-fetoprotein (AFP) > 50 unless negative imaging for hepatic masses within the last 6 months or during screening
- Refractory ascites as defined by requiring paracentesis > twice within 1 month prior to screening
- Active variceal bleeding within 6 months of screening
- Expected survival of < 1 year
- History of hepatorenal, or hepatopulmonary syndrome.
- Evidence of renal impairment (CrCl < 50 mL/min)
- History of major organ transplantation, including liver transplant.
